segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 3
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 3

segments.pli: 5. Cūḷavagga
segments.en: 5. The Lesser Chapter

segments.pli: 50. Mahācorasutta
segments.en: 50. A Master Thief

segments.pli: “Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato mahācoro sandhimpi chindati, nillopampi harati, ekāgārikampi karoti, paripanthepi tiṭṭhati.
segments.en: “Mendicants, a master thief with three factors breaks into houses, plunders wealth, steals from isolated buildings, and commits highway robbery.

segments.pli: Katamehi tīhi?
segments.en: What three?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, mahācoro visamanissito ca hoti, gahananissito ca hoti, balavanissito ca hoti.
segments.en: A master thief relies on uneven ground, on thick cover, and on powerful individuals.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, mahācoro visamanissito hoti?
segments.en: And how does a master thief rely on uneven ground?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, mahācoro nadīviduggaṃ vā nissito hoti pabbatavisamaṃ vā.
segments.en: It’s when a master thief relies on inaccessible riverlands or rugged mountains.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, mahācoro visamanissito hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a master thief relies on uneven ground.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, mahācoro gahananissito hoti?
segments.en: And how does a master thief rely on thick cover?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, mahācoro tiṇagahanaṃ vā nissito hoti, rukkhagahanaṃ vā rodhaṃ vā mahāvanasaṇḍaṃ vā.
segments.en: It’s when a master thief relies on thick grass, thick trees, a ridge, or a large dense wood.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, mahācoro gahananissito hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a master thief relies on thick cover.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, mahācoro balavanissito hoti?
segments.en: And how does a master thief rely on powerful individuals?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, mahācoro rājānaṃ vā rājamahāmattānaṃ vā nissito hoti.
segments.en: It’s when a master thief relies on rulers or their ministers.

segments.pli: Tassa evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: They think:

segments.pli: ‘sace maṃ koci kiñci vakkhati, ime me rājāno vā rājamahāmattā vā pariyodhāya atthaṃ bhaṇissantī’ti.
segments.en: ‘If anyone accuses me of anything, these rulers or their ministers will speak in my defense in the case.’

segments.pli: Sace naṃ koci kiñci āha, tyāssa rājāno vā rājamahāmattā vā pariyodhāya atthaṃ bhaṇanti.
segments.en: And that’s exactly what happens.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, mahācoro balavanissito hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a master thief relies on powerful individuals.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, tīhi aṅgehi samannāgato mahācoro sandhimpi chindati, nillopampi harati, ekāgārikampi karoti, paripanthepi tiṭṭhati.
segments.en: A master thief with these three factors breaks into houses, plunders wealth, steals from isolated buildings, and commits highway robbery.

segments.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tīhi aṅgehi samannāgato pāpabhikkhu khataṃ upahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati, sāvajjo ca hoti sānuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ, bahuñca apuññaṃ pasavati.
segments.en: In the same way, when a bad mendicant has three factors, they keep themselves broken and damaged. They deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they make much bad karma.

segments.pli: Katamehi tīhi?
segments.en: What three?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, pāpabhikkhu visamanissito ca hoti gahananissito ca balavanissito ca.
segments.en: A bad mendicant relies on uneven ground, on thick cover, and on powerful individuals.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, pāpabhikkhu visamanissito hoti?
segments.en: And how does a bad mendicant rely on uneven ground?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, pāpabhikkhu visamena kāyakammena samannāgato hoti, visamena vacīkammena samannāgato hoti, visamena manokammena samannāgato hoti.
segments.en: It’s when a bad mendicant has unethical conduct by way of body, speech, and mind.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, pāpabhikkhu visamanissito hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a bad mendicant relies on uneven ground.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, pāpabhikkhu gahananissito hoti?
segments.en: And how does a bad mendicant rely on thick cover?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, pāpabhikkhu micchādiṭṭhiko hoti, antaggāhikāya diṭṭhiyā samannāgato hoti.
segments.en: It’s when a bad mendicant has wrong view, he’s attached to an extremist view.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, pāpabhikkhu gahananissito hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a bad mendicant relies on thick cover.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, pāpabhikkhu balavanissito hoti?
segments.en: And how does a bad mendicant rely on powerful individuals?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, pāpabhikkhu rājānaṃ vā rājamahāmattānaṃ vā nissito hoti.
segments.en: It’s when a bad mendicant relies on rulers or their ministers.

segments.pli: Tassa evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: They think:

segments.pli: ‘sace maṃ koci kiñci vakkhati, ime me rājāno vā rājamahāmattā vā pariyodhāya atthaṃ bhaṇissantī’ti.
segments.en: ‘If anyone accuses me of anything, these rulers or their ministers will speak in my defense in the case.’

segments.pli: Sace naṃ koci kiñci āha, tyāssa rājāno vā rājamahāmattā vā pariyodhāya atthaṃ bhaṇanti.
segments.en: And that’s exactly what happens.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, pāpabhikkhu balavanissito hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a bad mendicant relies on powerful individuals.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhi dhammehi samannāgato pāpabhikkhu khataṃ upahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati, sāvajjo ca hoti sānuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ, bahuñca apuññaṃ pasavatī”ti.
segments.en: When a bad mendicant has these three factors, they keep themselves broken and damaged. They deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they make much bad karma.”

segments.pli: Ekādasamaṃ.
Cūḷavaggo pañcamo.
Sammukhī ṭhānatthavasaṃ,
pavatti paṇḍita sīlavaṃ;
Saṅkhataṃ pabbatātappaṃ,
mahācorenekādasāti.
Paṭhamo paṇṇāsako samatto.
